enum16.name: Object Type
enum16.tooltip: changing this would not be wise

bit.name: Object Uses Only Own Static Lightmap
Search Cardinal Direction Lightmaps On Failure
Extension Of Parent
bit.tooltip: object uses parent's markers

bit.name: Sample Environment Lighting Only Ignore Object Lighting
Effects Created By This Object Do Not Spawn Objects In Multiplayer
Does Not Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Force Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Damage Not Blocked By Obstructions
bit.tooltip: AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.

bit.name: Grab Parent Object In Forge Editing
Never Use Imposter For Shadow Generation

float32.name: Bounding Radius
float32.tooltip: If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.

float32.name: Dynamic Light Sphere Radius
float32.tooltip: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

tagRef.name: Collision Damage
tagRef.tooltip: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

tagRef.name: Melee Sound
tagRef.tooltip: this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

float32.name: Self-Destruct Time
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.

stringid.name: Interaction Name
stringid.tooltip: if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Mapping Does Not Controls Active
bit.tooltip: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

bit.name: Random Time Offset
bit.tooltip: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

bit.name: Always Exports Value
bit.tooltip: when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value

bit.name: Turn Off With Uses Magnitude
bit.tooltip: the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

stringid.name: Import Name
stringid.tooltip: if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable

stringid.name: Turn Off With
stringid.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

stringid.name: Ranged Interpolation Name
stringid.tooltip: if you have the ranged button checked

float32.name: Minimum Value
float32.tooltip: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

tagblock.name: Interpolation

option.name: Fractional
option.tooltip: covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

float32.name: Linear Travel Time
float32.tooltip: used by constant velocity

float32.name: Acceleration
float32.tooltip: used by linear acceleration

tagblock.comment: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

float32.name: Spring k
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines acceleration by displacement

float32.name: Spring c
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines damping based on velocity

float32.name: Fraction
float32.tooltip: used by fractional, how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

int32.name: Runtime Interpolator To Object Function Mapping

rangef.name: Selection Bounds
rangef.tooltip: if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

bit.name: Update State Animation and Keyframe Rigid Bodies Every Frame
Force Always On
bit.tooltip: when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string

bit.name: Effect Size Scale From Object Scale
Works On Land
bit.tooltip: drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

stringId.name: Variant Name
stringId.tooltip: if empty, may be used by any model variant

bit.name: Blend In HSV
bit.tooltip: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

bit.name: ...More Colors
bit.tooltip: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

tagblock.name: Multiplayer Object

flags8.name: Game Engine Flags
flags8.tooltip: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in

tagblock.comment: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

tagblock.name: Falloff Function
tagblock.tooltip: Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

tagblock.comment: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient

tagref.name: Spawned Object
tagref.tooltip: If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here

tagref.name: Simulation Interpolation
tagref.tooltip: Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

tagblock.name: Spawn Effects
tagblock.comment: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

tagRef.name: Multiplayer Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in MP games

tagRef.name: Survival Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Firefight games

tagRef.name: Campaign Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

bit.name: Blocks Headshots
bit.tooltip: like jackal shield

bit.name: Use Ground Scale For All Unspecified Attachments
Fixup Position Upon Detaching From Parent
Fixup Position After Attaching To Parent

plugin.comment: because grenades look better as coconuts. 0==1

tagref.name: Grounded Friction Settings
tagref.tooltip: If not present, the default from global.globals is used.

tagref.name: Tossed Override
tagref.tooltip: Used to override the object tossed when item owner is killed. Is overridden by tossed weapon override.

float32.name: Energy Recovery Time
float32.tooltip: after deactivation, energy stays constant for this long before starting to change by 'inactive energy rate'

bit.name: Never Dropped By AI
bit.tooltip: if an actor dies while carrying this, it gets deleted immediately does not affect dropping by players

bit.name: Can Not Be Picked Up By Player
Is Removed From World On Deactivation
bit.tooltip: used with supercombine attach

stringid.name: Unit Stow Marker Name
stringid.tooltip: the marker on the unit to attach this equipment to when it is stowed. The equipment should have a marker named "equipment_stow_anchor"

option.name: Automatic If Empty
option.tooltip: picks it up automatically, if you have no equipment in your inventory, otherwise, press RB to swap

option.name: Always Automatic
option.tooltip: always picks it up, whether or not you have another piece of equipment

option.name: Manual
option.tooltip: press RB to pickup or swap this equipment

option.name: Activate On Ground
option.tooltip: Never pickup, press RB to activate it in-place

colorf.name: Forced Primary Change Color
colorf.tooltip: sets the primary change color on the unit to this if the flag above is checked

colorf.name: Forced Secondary Change Color
colorf.tooltip: sets the secondary change color on the unit to this if the flag above is checked

plugin.comment: Settings which the AI use to know how they should react to this equipment

float32.name: Danger Radius
float32.tooltip: How large a danger zone we should create around this equipment (0 means no danger zone)

float32.name: Minimum Deployment Distance
float32.tooltip: How far does my target have to be for me to throw this at them?

float32.name: Awareness Time
float32.tooltip: How long I should go unnoticed by nearby enemies

stringid.name: AI Dialogue Equipment Type
stringid.tooltip: The equipment ability type name used by the ai dialog system used to filter equipment activation dialogue events.

bit.name: Hides Player-Unit From Camera
bit.tooltip: the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

bit.name: Use Aiming Vector Instead Of Marker Forward
bit.tooltip: for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

degree.name: Look Acceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking

degree.name: Look Deceleration
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

float32.name: Look Acceleration Smoothing Fraction
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, when the desired velocity change is less than this fraction of the acceleration, starts interpolating the maximum acceleration towards zero. You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

degree.name: Override Field Of View
degree.tooltip: if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

float32.name: Cylinder Fraction
float32.tooltip: controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

degree.name: Obstruction Test Angle
degree.tooltip: how wide of a cone to test

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Inward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Outward Acceleration
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current

float32.name: Obstruction Maximum Velocity
float32.tooltip: maximum speed the camera can move

float32.name: Obstruction Return Delay
float32.tooltip: when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

float32.name: Maximum Camera Velocity
float32.tooltip: how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Maximum Value
float32.tooltip: for linear velocity; this is wu/s. for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration. for angular velocity; this is deg/s

float32.name: Camera Scale (Axial)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera

float32.name: Camera Scale (Perpendicular)
float32.tooltip: scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

float32.name: Peg Threshold
float32.tooltip: [0,1] magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

point2.name: Pegged Time
point2.tooltip: time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect

point2.name: Pegged Scale
point2.tooltip: the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

degree.name: Peg Maximum Angular Velocity
degree.tooltip: the maximum turning speed during peg

tagblock.name: Abilities

float32.name: Duration
float32.tooltip: use negative numbers for infinite duration

float32.name: Warmup Time
float32.tooltip: time before the equipment truly becomes active

float32.name: Cooldown Time
float32.tooltip: for equipment that suppresses combat actions, these actions remain suppressed for this long after the equipment deactivates. Note that if this equipment also readies weapons when deactivated, the weapon will not be usable until both this timer expires and the ready animation has finished, whichever is longer

float32.name: Phantom Volume Activation Time
float32.tooltip: time in seconds for the phantom volumes on this object to start accelerating things in them

tagblock.comment: All these fields are additive, meaning a negative number will reduce energy and a positive one will increase energy. Every piece of equipment starts at 1.0 energy

float32.name: Minimum Activation Energy
float32.tooltip: energy must be at least this high to activate. Like activation cost, but doesn't actually change energy levels

float32.name: Low Energy Warning Threshold
float32.tooltip: used by UI

dataref.name: Movement Speed To Energy Rate Function

bit.name: Cannot Be Active While Airborne
bit.tooltip: if checked, this equipment cannot be activated if the user is airborne, and deactivates itself if the user becomes airborne

bit.name: Cannot Activate While Airborne
bit.tooltip: can't activate in midair, but doesn't turn off if you later become airborne

bit.name: Cannot Activate While Standing On Biped
bit.tooltip: if you are standing on another biped you can not use this equipment

bit.name: Cannot Be Active In Vehicle
bit.tooltip: can't be activated in a seat, and deactivates if a vehicle is entered

bit.name: Cannot Be Active While Motion Is Modified By Physics
bit.tooltip: e.g. by mancannon

bit.name: Suppresses Hero-Assist-Equipment Use While Active
bit.tooltip: probably this means sprint

bit.name: Activation Animation Suppresses Weapons And Melee
Readies Weapon On Deactivation
bit.tooltip: note - if this equipment has an animation cycle, the weapon is readied after the exit animation finishes. Otherwise the weapon-ready happens immediately on deactivation

bit.name: Drops Support/Must Be Readied Weapons On Activation
Hides Weapon On Activation
bit.tooltip: checking this flag will automatically cause the weapon to ready on deactivation

bit.name: Cannot Activate In Vehicle
bit.tooltip: cannot activate while in vehicle, but previously activated equipment remains active

bit.name: Ignore Auto-Pick-Up Weapons While Active
bit.tooltip: Prevents auto-pick-up of weapons set to auto by megalo action weapon_set_picup_priority

bit.name: Suppresses Weapon Zoom During Activation Animation
bit.tooltip: the equipment only suppresses zoom during its activation animation

bit.name: Suppresses Jumping During Activation Animation
bit.tooltip: only suppresses jumping during its activation animation

bit.name: Suppresses Vehicle Entry During Activation Animation
bit.tooltip: only suppresses vehicle entry during its activation animation

bit.name: Suppresses Grenade Usage During Activation Animation
bit.tooltip: only suppresses grenade usage during its activation animation

bit.name: Hide Reticule During During Weapon Ready
Deactivating During Warmup Will Apply Deactivation Energy Penalty
Deactivating During Warmup Will Fire Deactivation Effects
Ignores Normal Support Weapon Force Deactivation Of Equipment
bit.tooltip: used by Auto Turret to bypass how support weapons force equipment deactivation

option.name: Toggle
option.tooltip: toggles state when X is pressed

option.name: Hold
option.tooltip: activates when X is pressed and deactivates when X is released

option.name: Double Tap
option.tooltip: activates when X is pressed twice in quick succession

int8.name: Object Noise Adjustment
int8.tooltip: for AI perception. while active, adjusts noises made by the owner unit by this many 'notches'. note that this is additive, so a positive number is louder and a negative number is quieter

float32.name: Spawn Radius
float32.tooltip: distance from players eyeball on the z-plane that this effect spawns

float32.name: Spawn z Offset
float32.tooltip: z-offset of effect spawn

float32.name: Spawn Area Radius
float32.tooltip: need a sphere of radius r's free space in order to spawn, otherwise we pick a new spawn location

float32.name: Spawn Radius
float32.tooltip: distance from players eyeball on the z-plane that this effect spawns

float32.name: Spawn a Offset
float32.tooltip: z-offset of effect spawn

float32.name: Spawn Area Radius
float32.tooltip: need a sphere of radius r's free space in order to spawn, otherwise we pick a new spawn location

float32.name: Arm Time
float32.tooltip: time before it becomes a proximity mine

float32.name: Self Destruct Time
float32.tooltip: seconds after it is created that it must self destruct. 0 means never destroy

float32.name: Trigger Time
float32.tooltip: seconds object moving at trigger velocity takes to trigger explosion. This will smooth out sensitivity to velocity noise

float32.name: Trigger Velocity
float32.tooltip: WU/sec at which we trigger explosion

float32.name: Arm Time
float32.tooltip: time before it starts making noise

float32.name: Noise Radius
float32.tooltip: radius in WU that the noise extends to.

int32.name: Noise Count
int32.tooltip: number of noise points that are generated

float32.name: Flash Radius
float32.tooltip: radius in WU that the damage flash noise extends to.

float32.name: Shield Recharge Rate
float32.tooltip: while active, shields recharge at this fraction per second

float32.name: Shield Maximum Recharge Level
float32.tooltip: highest level shield can recharge to (can be up to 4)

stringid.name: Loop-Invincibility Shield Name
stringid.tooltip: active while the equipment is in use (used for shield rendering effects)

stringid.name: Post-Invincibility Shield Name
stringid.tooltip: active once the equipment is no longer in use

dataref.name: Post-Invincibility Time To Shield Level Function

float32.name: Maximum Vertical Velocity
float32.tooltip: we use this to specify the domain of the active vertical velocity funtion

tagblock.name: Threshold Effects
tagblock.tooltip: the effect with the highest threshold will play on deactivation

float32.name: Threshold Energy Burned
float32.tooltip: how much energy you have to burn to play this effect

float32.name: Energy Adjustment
float32.tooltip: how much energy to add when playing this effect

tagblock.name: Vitality Traits

bit.name: Wheelman Armor Vehicle Stun Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle Recharge Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle EMP Disabled Time Modifier

tagblock.comment: Any damage taken is divided by this number. If you put -1, that means "invulnerable".

float32.name: Explosive Damage Resistance
float32.tooltip: incoming damage multiplied by (1 - resistance)

float32.name: Wheelman Armor Vehicle Stun Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle Recharge Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle EMP Disabled Time Modifier

tagblock.name: Weapon Traits

bit.name: Hero Equipment Energy Use Rate Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Delay Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Rate Modifier
Equipment Energy Use Recharge Rate Modifier
Explosive Area Of Effect Radius Modifier

float32.name: Hero Equipment Energy Use Rate Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Delay Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Rate Modifier
Equipment Energy Use Recharge Rate Modifier
Explosive Area Of Effect Radius Modifier

enum8.name: Equipment Usage Excepting Auto Turret
enum8.tooltip: false will disable all equipment except auto turret

tagblock.comment: Type any string from the relevant sections of multiplayer/globals.multiplayer_object_type_list.

tagblock.name: Appearance Traits
tagblock.comment: Type any string from the relevant sections of multiplayer/megalo/multiplayer_effects.multiplayereffects.

option.name: Moving Friendly Bipeds Moving Neutral Vehicles

tagblock.name: Vitality Traits

bit.name: Wheelman Armor Vehicle Stun Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle Recharge Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle Emp Disabled Time Modifier

tagblock.comment: Any damage taken is divided by this number. If you put -1, that means "invulnerable".

float32.name: Explosive Damage Resistance
float32.tooltip: incoming damage multiplied by (1 - resistance)

float32.name: Wheelman Armor Vehicle Stun Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle Recharge Time Modifier
Wheelman Armor Vehicle Emp Disabled Time Modifier

tagblock.name: Weapon Traits

bit.name: Hero Equipment Energy Use Rate Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Delay Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Rate Modifier
Equipment Energy Use Recharge Rate Modifier
Explosive Area Of Effect Radius Modifier

float32.name: Hero Equipment Energy Use Rate Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Delay Modifier
Hero Equipment Energy Recharge Rate Modifier
Equipment Energy Use Recharge Rate Modifier
Explosive Area Of Effect Radius Modifier

enum8.name: Equipment Usage Excepting Auto Turret
enum8.tooltip: false will disable all equipment except auto turret

tagblock.comment: Type any string from the relevant sections of multiplayer/globals.multiplayer_object_type_list.

tagblock.name: Appearance Traits
tagblock.comment: Type any string from the relevant sections of multiplayer/megalo/multiplayer_effects.multiplayereffects.

option.name: Moving Friendly Bipeds Moving Neutral Vehicles

tagblock.name: Appearance Traits
tagblock.comment: Traits that affect the AI's appearance

tagblock.name: Appearance Traits
tagblock.comment: Traits that affect the AI's appearance

tagblock.name: Stasis Field
tagblock.comment: The effective rate at which time passes for objects in the field. Values below 0.45 screw up jumping.

float32.name: Time Dilation Other
float32.tooltip: everything else

float32.name: Gravity Multiplier
float32.tooltip: negative values will invert gravity

tagblock.name: Ball Lightning
tagblock.comment: Damage effect that passes from one biped to nearby bipeds, recursively

float32.name: Chain Radius Reduction Multiplier
float32.tooltip: MUST BE GREATER THAN ZERO - each time lightning chains, this is the multiplier that controls how much the radius is reduced by

bit.name: Shield Vitality Tied To Energy
bit.tooltip: as energy goes down, the shield vitality will as well

float32.name: Shield Damage To Energy Scale
float32.tooltip: scale factor for energy gain from shield damage to child. Damage is normalized, so if this value is -1.0 then the equipment will lose all its energy when its child's shield is depleted.

float32.name: Starting Warm Up Object Scale
float32.tooltip: if >0 (and warm up time is >0), object size will scale up from this up to 1.0 over course of warm up time and down over cooldown time

point3.name: Offset From Parent
point3.tooltip: the root of the child is offset by this amount from the root of the parent biped

float32.name: Vertical Offset In World Space
float32.tooltip: used to adjust hight per biped, regardless of aim direction

rangef.name: Pitch
rangef.tooltip: the min and max pitch that the child will follow as you aim up and down. -90 to 90

dataref.name: Health Given Over Energy Used Function

tagblock.name: Jet Pack

bit.name: Use Camera And Movement For Thrust Dir
bit.tooltip: Jetpack thrust dir is controlled by camera dir and player movement (signifies Zero-G jet pack)

bit.name: Cache Thrust At Activation
bit.tooltip: don't let the player change the direction of thrust once they activate

dataref.name: Infinite Energy Thrust To Acceleration Function

float32.name: Negative Velocity Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: when falling, scale the thrust by this (so you can 'catch' yourself easier)

float32.name: Grounded Acceleration Magnitude
float32.tooltip: how hard to kick you upwards if you activate while grounded

float32.name: Landing Anticipation Time
float32.tooltip: how many seconds before landing the jetpack user enters the airborne arc

tagblock.comment: These apply if 'Use camera and movement for thrust dir' flag is checked

float32.name: Camera vs Move Input Thrust Control
float32.tooltip: Camera direction (0.0) VS movement input (1.0) interpolation

float32.name: Minimum Speed
float32.tooltip: drag will be applied above this

float32.name: Drag Cutoff Time
float32.tooltip: if 0, drag is always applied

float32.name: Cow Catcher Height
float32.tooltip: world units

float32.name: Cow Catcher Front Width
float32.tooltip: world units, the width of the flat front portion of the cow-catcher

float32.name: Cow Catcher Side Width
float32.tooltip: world units, the width of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher

float32.name: Cow Catcher Side Depth
float32.tooltip: world units, the depth of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher

vector3.name: Cow Catcher Offset
vector3.tooltip: offset from the unit's origin to put the origin of the cow-catcher at

tagRef.name: Collision Damage Override
tagRef.tooltip: if "hide unit during transit" isn't checked, this can override the unit's collision damage definition during the teleport

float32.name: Shimmer Decrease Rate
float32.tooltip: how fast shimmer decreases

float32.name: Shimmer Bullet Ping
float32.tooltip: how much to ping shimmer when hit by a bullet

bit.name: Driveable
bit.tooltip: hologram is automatically bump possessed by the player

float32.name: Danger Radius
float32.tooltip: AI avoidance radius. Ignored if zero.

float32.name: Speed Multiplier
float32.tooltip: Use this instead of a trait. 0 defaults to 1. With a trait, the client will move at non-modified scale until it gets replicated.

tagblock.name: Teleporter
tagblock.comment: This causes you to warp forward. It'll trace the path with an effect at the specified speed, then spawn you at the end of it.

bit.name: Hide Unit During Transit
bit.tooltip: during the teleport, hide the unit and turn off collision

bit.name: Disable Shortened Teleport
bit.tooltip: makes it so that we always thrust or teleport the full distance; not wise unless "hide unit during transit" is unchecked

bit.name: Disable Extra Probes
bit.tooltip: only the center probe is cast, no extra probes

bit.name: Force Along Aim Vector
bit.tooltip: ignores all search vector parameters and uses the aim vector as the search vector

bit.name: Can Pass Through Objects
bit.tooltip: only collides against environment and structures

bit.name: Force Along Stick Direction
bit.tooltip: if stick throw magnitude==0 then search in facing direction, else search in stick direction

float32.name: Travel Speed
float32.tooltip: the speed at which you cross the teleporter distance; 0 means instant

float32.name: Deactivation Speed
float32.tooltip: the speed you return to at the end of the teleport, if "hide unit during transit" isn't checked

tagRef.name: Trace Effect
tagRef.tooltip: an effect that will follow along the travel path

vector3.name: Trace Effect Offset
vector3.tooltip: offset from the unit's origin to put the effects at

float32.name: Maximum Pitch (Airborne)
float32.tooltip: [-90 to 90] the pitch of the search vector will be clamped to no higher than this when starting a teleport in the air

float32.name: Maximum Pitch (Ground)
float32.tooltip: [-90 to 90] the pitch of the search vector will be clamped to no higher than this when starting a teleport on the ground

tagblock.comment: If "force along aim vector" isn't checked, the start vector will be your motion vector, plus some amount of weight for where you're looking, if you're moving along your look vector.

float32.name: Look Vector Weight
float32.tooltip: value from 0 to 1 for how much we can use the look vector in place of the movement vector

float32.name: Look Vector Falloff Inner
float32.tooltip: degrees, inside this angle, we use the look vector at full weight

float32.name: Look Vector Falloff Outer
float32.tooltip: degrees, outside this angle, we only use the movement vector

float32.name: Move Vector Vertical Offset
float32.tooltip: degrees, how much to offset the move vector vertically; positive is up, negative is down

tagblock.comment: If "disable extra probes" isn't checked, we'll do a fan of rays vertically from our central vector, with one probe horizontally on either side of each of those rays.

float32.name: Horizontal Probe Angle
float32.tooltip: degrees, the angle to each side of the horizontal probes

float32.name: Vertical Probe Angle
float32.tooltip: degrees, the angle up and down covered by the fan of vertical rays

int32.name: Number Of Vertical Probes
int32.tooltip: higher is more likely to find a good match, but more expensive

tagblock.comment: If "hide unit during transit" isn't checked, we'll add a cow-catcher collision volume on the front and change the collision damage type.

float32.name: Cow Catcher Height
float32.tooltip: world units

float32.name: Cow Catcher Front Width
float32.tooltip: world units, the width of the flat front portion of the cow-catcher

float32.name: Cow Catcher Side Width
float32.tooltip: world units, the width of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher

float32.name: Cow Catcher Side Depth
float32.tooltip: world units, the depth of the angled side portion of the cow-catcher

vector3.name: Cow Catcher Offset
vector3.tooltip: offset from the unit's origin to put the origin of the cow-catcher at

tagRef.name: Collision Damage Override
tagRef.tooltip: if "hide unit during transit" isn't checked, this can override the unit's collision damage definition during the teleport

bit.name: Turret Follows Player
bit.tooltip: if set, turret follows player, otherwise it moves to a specific location

bit.name: Turret Fake Gravity
bit.tooltip: if set, turret will sink to a height defined in y orbit offset below

point3.name: Orbit Offset From Player
point3.tooltip: z forward, x right, y down. Set x,z zero to get independent turret, y is altitude off ground

float32.name: Orbit Range
float32.tooltip: if above are zeros, this is max turret range

float32.name: Maximum Range
float32.tooltip: if not following player, maximum distance downrange turret will travel

float32.name: Turret Halt Engage Time
float32.tooltip: amount of time after a moving turret engages a target before it halts movement

float32.name: Turret Idle Equipment Drain Multiplier
float32.tooltip: the multiplier on equipment drain when equipment is in its idle state

float32.name: Turret Inactive Equipment Drain Multiplier
float32.tooltip: the multiplier on equipment drain when equipment is in its inactive state

float32.name: Spawn Radius
float32.tooltip: area that must be clear in order for turret to spawn

float32.name: Spawn In Time
float32.tooltip: the turret will be inactive for this duration

vector3.name: Spawn Offset From Player
vector3.tooltip: relative to origin and camera direction without pitch

tagRef.name: Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played on the turret when it is spawned into the world

tagRef.name: Collision Phase Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played on the turret while a biped or vehicle passes through it

bit.name: Apply Tell Damage Response To Friends

float32.name: Maximum Tell Distance
float32.tooltip: 'Other activation tell effect' will be applied to players within this distance

tagRef.name: Activation Tell Effect
tagRef.tooltip: applied to other players within maximum distance

int32.name: Motion Sensor Tell Blip Ticks
int32.tooltip: within 'maxiumum tell distance' blip duration if 'Generate tell motion sensor blip' is checked

float32.name: Lifetime
float32.tooltip: Number of seconds a projected shield will remain active.

float32.name: Recharge Time
float32.tooltip: Number of seconds between shield projections.

float32.name: Warmup Time
float32.tooltip: Number of seconds it takes to activate a projection.

float32.name: Maximum Move Percentage
float32.tooltip: Percentage of distance between current and desired positions a shield can be moved per update tick.

float32.name: Offset Amount
float32.tooltip: Distance from defender's position to project the shield.

float32.name: Minimum Projection Distance
float32.tooltip: Minimum distance between defender and attacker required to project shield.

float32.name: Maximum Projection Distance
float32.tooltip: Max distance from equipment that shield can be projected.

float32.name: Minimum Required Energy Level
float32.tooltip: Min energy required to activate shield.

tagRef.name: Project Effect
tagRef.tooltip: Beam effect that links equipment to projected shield.

tagRef.name: Warmup Effect
tagRef.tooltip: Effect played at eventual shield projection point during warmup period.

tagRef.name: Shield Crate
tagRef.tooltip: Crate created to represent projected shield.

float32.name: Chance To Collect
float32.tooltip: Percent chance (0-1) that collector has to collect each grenade. Will only attempt to collect each grenade once.

rangef.name: Collect Cooldown
rangef.tooltip: Number of seconds collector must wait between successful collections.

rangef.name: Attack Delay
rangef.tooltip: Number of seconds collector must wait before throwing a collected projectile at a target.

float32.name: Maximum Collect Range
float32.tooltip: Max range in world units that collector can collect and hold onto projectiles.

rangef.name: Orbit Radius
rangef.tooltip: Collector will try to keep collected projectiles orbiting in this range.

float32.name: Orbit Speed
float32.tooltip: Speed at which collected projectiles orbit.

float32.name: Vertical Offset
float32.tooltip: Orbit vertical offset amount.

float32.name: Strength
float32.tooltip: Controls amount of acceleration applied to projectile.

float32.name: Attack Speed
float32.tooltip: Initial speed of projectiles when thrown as an attack.

tagRef.name: Collect Effect
tagRef.tooltip: Beam effect that links equipment to each collected projectile.

float32.name: Acceleration
float32.tooltip: this is a percentage of max velocity per second - 0.1 reaches max velocity in 10 seconds

float32.name: Decay Rate
float32.tooltip: the rate at which a moving camera decays when you release the stick. Lower decays faster.

bit.name: Ordnance UI
bit.tooltip: special version of RS use for ordnance droppod UI

bit.name: Target Designator
bit.tooltip: target designator is in weapon field

float32.name: Base Drain Per Second
float32.tooltip: Will be multiplied by a value from the drain level block.

float32.name: Energy Recovery Delay
float32.tooltip: The targeted equipment will not start regenerating energy until at least this much time has gone by.

float32.name: Cone Angle Degrees
float32.tooltip: Degrees away from the reticle at which targets are in the cone.

float32.name: Cutoff Distance
float32.tooltip: Targets within this distance will be affected by this multiplier.

float32.name: Drain Multiplier
float32.tooltip: Multiplied by the base drain per second.

tagRef.name: Cone Effect
tagRef.tooltip: an effect that will shoot out of your face

tagRef.name: Target Effect
tagRef.tooltip: an effect that will play on the target

tagRef.name: Hologram Spawner
tagRef.tooltip: reference the equipment that will spawn the hologram that will pilot the remote vehicle

tagRef.name: Vehicle
tagRef.tooltip: reference the remote vehicle to be created

stringid.name: Seat Label
stringid.tooltip: hologram gets loaded into this seat in the vehicle

stringid.name: Spawn Position Flag
stringid.tooltip: position of scenerio flag with this name. Empty will default to flag named 'remote_vehicle_start_position'

bit.name: Pause Shield Stun Timer
bit.tooltip: false forces full amount of stun following deactivation

tagRef.name: Activation While Disabled By Player Traits Sound
Player Sound Bank
tagRef.tooltip: High quality player sound bank to be prefetched. Can be empty.

float32.name: Switch Point
float32.tooltip: value of the function (between 0 and 1) where the sound is triggered

int32.name: Mode
int32.tooltip: 0 for triggering while function is decreasing, 1 for increasing (more modes to come?)
